meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a particular generation.
meanings.sent1: The generationally diverse group of students brought unique perspectives to the discussion.
meanings.sent2: The study focused on the generationally different attitudes towards technology.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see how generationally varied the preferences for music were at the family gathering.
meanings.sent4: The generationally shifting landscape of fashion trends keeps designers on their toes.
meanings.sent5: The generationally distinct fashion styles of the 60s and 70s are still influential today.

meanings.sent1: The researchers studied the generationally inherited traits in the population.
meanings.sent2: The impact of climate change is a generationally significant concern for future inhabitants.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to observe the generationally slow progress of the ancient oak tree's growth.
meanings.sent4: The generationally evolving technology has revolutionized communication methods.
meanings.sent5: The generationally passed-down traditions hold a special place in the community's heart.
